children.subject: Given that EE 126 is NOT accepted in place of Stat 134/140 for the Stat major (I asked this 3-4 semesters ago), this would be highly unlikely as well.

history.content: Just to let you know that the Stats department usually does not enforce pre requisites, so if you have the necessary knowledge from other classes, I don't think there should be much stopping you from taking Stats courses. However, as the person below mentioned, do not expect to get credit for EECS 126 in lieu of 134/140 in case you're thinking of majoring/minoring in Stats (in my opinion, the Stats department is especially stubborn with things like these and I do not understand why).

Just to let you know that the Stats department usually does not enforce pre requisites, so if you have the necessary knowledge from other classes. I don't think there should be much stopping you from taking Stats courses. However, as the person below mentioned, do not expect to get credit for EECS 126 in lieu of 134/140 in case you're thinking of majoring/minoring (in my opinion, the Stats department is especially stubborn with things like these).

Hi, I recently saw that in order to take upper-division Statistics class like Stat 135, you need to take Stat 134/Prob 140 beforehand. As someone who wants to do ML, I planned to take EE 126/CS 189 next semester. I also wanted to take more statistics courses afterwards, but now am not sure if it is possible if I don't take Stat 134/Prob 140 beforehand. Does anyone know anything about how the prerequisites are being enforced, and if EE 126 can get you out of any of them? Thank you!
history.subject: Stats Prereq Enforcement
